results.title: Ballerina
results.brief_description: A film portrait of Margaret Mercier, graduate of Sadler’s Wells Ballet, prima ballerina of Les Grands Ballets Canadiens, Montreal and a student of the Bolshoi Ballet. She tells her own story in this film - how she feels about the demands of her art, the dedication, energy, work and persistence that it requires.

results.title: Ballad of Lucy Jordan
results.brief_description: Animated adaptation of the song by Dr. Hook, using mainly photographic stills to tell the sad and ironic tale of a thirty seven year old house wife whose daydreams lead only to despair.
results.description: Animated adaptation of the song by Dr. Hook, using mainly photographic stills to tell the sad and ironic tale of a thirty seven year old house wife whose daydreams lead only to despair.

results.title: Ballad of Joe Hill
results.brief_description: Joseph Hillstrom, a young Swedish migrant to America in 1902, found prejudice and corruption instead of the equality and opportunity he was expecting. Disturbed by the injustices suffered by workers, Joe Hillstrom became an organizer of the Industrial Workers of the World, the legendary big union with anarchist reputation.

results.title: Ball on vole
results.brief_description: The apparently aimless flight of a ball which goes out of reach and wanders where it will, is presented in a series of amusing incidents and co-incidences as five boys try to capture it. Drama follows its appearance wherever it goes, people are bumped and shot, and it eludes them to the end. A whimsical film with a unique sense of humour.

results.title: Ball handling in basketball
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basketball”.
Professional male basketball players demonstrate stance, grip, fingertip control, “feel” of the ball, adjustment before shooting, watching the ball, and how to meet passes.

results.title: Balked at the altar
results.creator_credit: D.W. Griffith and American Mutoscope and Biograph Company
results.brief_description: An eligible bachelor becomes an unwilling victim of a father’s plan to help his daughter find a husband. Cast includes Mabel Stoughton, Linda Arvidson, George Gebhardt, D.W. Griffith, Robert Harron, Mack Sennett, Arthur V. Johnson, Harry Solter. Silent film with musical soundtrack.

results.title: Bali: the release of a soul
results.creator_credit: John Phillips, Ted Myers and United Cinema
results.brief_description: To the Balinese, life and religion are one. The film explains this as it explains some aspects of the school system, religion and village life, to the accompaniment of gamelan music.

results.title: Bali today
results.brief_description: Illustrates life on the small volcanic island of Bali in Indonesia. Emphasises the role of the Brahmin religion in everyday life, with scenes of the rice harvest, colourful dance ceremonies, and flower offerings to the gods. Examples of weaving and mask-making illustrates Balinese art. No other credits available.

results.title: Balada O Podravini
results.brief_description: A big, featherless bird helps us discover Podravina and its inhabitants. It is autumn, the crops are in, and we are invited to a country fair and a funeral. We understand how the peasants approach life and the world around them through this animated film.
results.description: A big, featherless bird helps us discover Podravina and its inhabitants. It is autumn, the crops are in, and we are invited to a country fair and a funeral. We understand how the peasants approach life and the world around them through this animated film.

results.title: Baking unleavened bread: Pushtu Nomads
results.creator_credit: Hermann Schlenker, Julien Bryan and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description: Reveals the simple but physically demanding life of the nomadic Pushtu. Shows a Pushtu wife skilfully fashioning large flat discs of dough and baking each separately by pressing it into the convex side of a great copper pan. Suitable for Upper Primary-Middle Secondary students.
